text:
Technology has always
been a passion of mine.
My goal is to try to be as ethical

and responsible as I
can be as an engineer.

I would like to use
artificial intelligence
to bring change and to improve the
living standards of Kenyans.
My name is Olympiah Otieno,
Gedeon Baende,
Vilija Vainaite,
and I am Prerana Sapkota.

When I started the AWS AI
and ML Scholarship program,
I could actually learn through doing.

And I was able to take my
education into my own hands.

Using AI, my team and I
have created a software

to diagnose the remaining
capacity in used EV batteries
and repurpose that power for further use.
My colleagues and I have made
a mobile application called iFARM.

With AI, farmers are able
to detect crop diseases
and help them get a large harvest.

We have created the Women4Cyber
The Netherlands chapter
to show it is possible to become
a female leader in the technical field.
Education is something
that can make you independent.

Why not give back to this
community what I have learned?
I now know that I am capable
of doing well in this particular field.
It's amazing when you think about it.
